org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.widgets
Class MTTextArea

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.components.MTComponent
      org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.AbstractVisibleComponent
          org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes.AbstractShape
              org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes.MTCSSStylableShape
                  org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes.MTPolygon
                      org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes.MTRectangle
                          org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.widgets.MTTextArea
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>, CSSStylableComponent, IMTComponent, IMTComponent3D, ITextInputListener, IMTInputEventListener, ILassoable, IGestureEventListener
public class MTTextArea
extends MTRectangle
implements ITextInputListener, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>

The Class MTTextArea. This widget allows to display text with a specified font. If the constructor with no fixed text are dimensions is used, the text area will expand itself to fit the text in.
If the constructor with fixed dimensions is used, the text will have word wrapping and be clipped to the specified dimensions.

Author:
Christopher Ruff

Nested Class Summary
static class MTTextArea.ExpandDirection
          Determines the vertical expand direction of the MTTextArea if the text area will expand itself to fit the text in.

Constructor Detail

MTTextArea

public MTTextArea(processing.core.PApplet pApplet)
Instantiates a new text area. This constructor creates a text area with variable dimensions that expands itself when text is added. A default font is used.

Parameters:
pApplet - the applet

updateComponent

public void updateComponent(long timeDelta)
Description copied from class: MTComponent
Tells the component to update its state if neccessary. This is called shortly before the component's drawComponent() method is invoked at every frame. The timeDelta parameter indicates the time passed since the last frame was drawn and can be used for animations for example.
Also, this updates the associated IMTController object if existing. If overriden, the superclass implementation should always be called!
NOTE: Be aware that this method is called every frame, so doing expensive calculations in it may slow down the application.

Specified by:
updateComponent in interface IMTComponent
Overrides:
updateComponent in class MTComponent
Parameters:
timeDelta - the time delta

drawComponent

public void drawComponent(processing.core.PGraphics g)
Description copied from class: MTComponent
Executes this component's drawing commands (Not its children!). The component's matrix has to be made current before drawing.
This method can be overridden in subclasses and filled with drawing commands.
NOTE: This method is called by the application. Usually you should not invoke this method directly!

Specified by:

setBitmapFontTextureFiltered

public void setBitmapFontTextureFiltered(boolean scalable)
Changes the texture filtering for the textarea's bitmap font. (if a bitmap font is used). If the parameter is "true" this will allow the text being scaled without getting too pixelated. If the text isnt going to be scaled ever, it is best to leave or set this to "false" for a sharper text.
NOTE: Only applies if OpenGL is the renderer and the textarea uses a bitmap font.
NOTE: This affects the whole bitmap font so if it is used elsewhere it is changed there, too.

Parameters:
scalable - the new bitmap font scalable

getExpandDirection

public MTTextArea.ExpandDirection getExpandDirection()
Returns the currently active expand direction of the text area. (Only has an impact if the wrap mode of the textarea equals MODE_EXPAND!)

Returns:
the active expand direction

setExpandDirection

public void setExpandDirection(MTTextArea.ExpandDirection direction)
Sets the expand direction to be used by the text area if a new line is added. (Only has an impact if the wrap mode of the textarea equals MODE_EXPAND!)

Parameters:
direction - the expand direction to be used
See Also:
ExpandDirection}

setSizeLocal

public void setSizeLocal(float width,
                         float height)
Description copied from class: MTRectangle
Sets the size locally, meaning that not the transformation of the rectangle is changed, (as setSize/setWidth, scale etc. would do) but the vertices of the rectangle themselves. This is useful if we dont want the rectangles children to be scaled as well, for example.
Note: The scaling is done from the rectangles upper left corner - not the center!

Overrides:
setSizeLocal in class MTRectangle
Parameters:
width - the width
height - the height
